required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Epigenetic Effects of a Single Bout of Exercise on Cardiovascular Risk Factors and the Metabolome
clinical_study.official_title: Epigenetic Effects of a Single Bout of Exercise on Cardiovascular Risk Factors and the Metabolome in Lean and Overweight or Obese Subjects

collaborator.agency: Louisiana State University Health Sciences Center Shreveport

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the ability of acute exercise to regulate fat metabolism in muscle of overweight and obese people compared to lean people.

detailed_description.textblock: After being informed about the study details and possible risks and benefits, 15 overweight/obese and 15 lean participants gave written informed consent and were then screened and enrolled in the study. All participants then gave a muscle sample and ate a calorically controlled breakfast. Participants completed ~1 hour of cycling exercise on a stationary bike and gave a second muscle sample 4 hours after eating breakfast.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All participants underwent the same exact study protocol on random days throughout the study period.
study_design_info.masking_description: Investigators conducting molecular analysis were blinded to study samples/groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in skeletal muscle acylcarnitines
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and immediately after acute cycling exercise
primary_outcome.description: Metabolomics of skeletal muscle acylcarnitines is used as a measure of mitochondrial function by assessing long, medium and short chain acylcarnitine levels.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in skeletal transcriptome
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and immediately after acute cycling exercise
primary_outcome.description: RNA-seq is a method used to quantify changes in all known messenger RNA levels in the genome, giving an assessment of whole genome gene transcription changes.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in skeletal muscle whole genome nucleosome maps
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and immediately after acute cycling exercise
primary_outcome.description: MNase-seq is a method used to determine the occupancy/location of nucleosomes throughout the entire genome, supporting evidence of alterations in epigenetic modifications occurring at specific genomic loci that affect nucleosome occupancy/location and possibly gene transcription or silencing.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and immediately after acute cycling exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Commercially validated and available colorimetric used to determine plasma glucose levels.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and immediately after acute cycling exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Commercially validated and available ELISAs used to determine plasma insulin levels.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and immediately after acute cycling exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Commercially validated and available colorimetric kits used to determine plasma triglyceride levels.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and immediately after acute cycling exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Commercially validated and available colorimetric kits used to determine plasma free fatty acid levels.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and immediately after acute cycling exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Commercially validated and available colorimetric kits used to determine total cholesterol, HDL, LDL and VLDL levels in plasma.

intervention.description: All participants consumed a standardized, high carbohydrate meal (7 kcal/kg; 60% carbohydrate, 25% fat, 15% protein) and completed an exercise testing trial, expending a total of 650 kcal upon completion 4h later.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy males that completed a physical examination with a State Licensed M.D. or D.O. within the past 2 years and completed a physical activity readiness questionnaire (PARQ), the International Physical Activity Questionnaires (IPAQ) and and a medical history questionnaire prior to the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- any participants that had not had a physical examination by a State Licensed M.D. or D.O. within the past 2 years
- persons not considered "healthy" (with any previous medical diagnoses) or not medically cleared by a M.D. or D.O. to perform physical activity/exercise
- persons who are regularly physically active

overall_official.affiliation: Purdue University, Louisiana State University Medical School at Shreveport
